content:
{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-102-13-B
|Item_parent=Diplopia
|Item_parent_short=Diplopia
|Rank=B
|Title=Knowing the ophthalmological causes of monocular diplopia
|Description=photo of cataract, corneal cleft
|Rubric=Positive diagnosis
|Contributors=
|Order=13}}
Monocular diplopia persists with occlusion of the healthy eye and disappears with occlusion of the pathological eye. This may be due to :

'''- corneal''' by diffraction of light rays: corneal scarring following keratitis or trauma, keratoconus, significant astigmatism.

'''- irienne :''' traumatic iridodialysis

'''- crystalline:''' nuclear cataract

correct_option.title: Correct Option
correct_option.description: This consists only a letter of the correct option
